1.name: The Godfather: Part II
1.description: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

2.name: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre
2.description: Two siblings and three of their friends en route to visit their grandfather's grave in Texas end up falling victim to a family of cannibalistic psychopaths And must survive the terrors of leatherface and his family.

3.name: Blazing Saddles
3.description: In order to ruin a western town, a corrupt politician appoints a black Sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary.

4.name: Chinatown
4.description: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

5.name: Young Frankenstein
5.description: An American grandson of the infamous scientist, struggling to prove that his grandfather was not as insane as people believe, is invited to Transylvania, where he discovers the process that reanimates a dead body.

6.name: Black Christmas
6.description: During their Christmas break, a group of sorority girls are stalked by a stranger.

7.name: Claudine
7.description: In the 1970s Harlem, garbage collector Roop feels intimidated by the idea of dating Claudine who is a single mother of six on welfare.

8.name: The Man with the Golden Gun
8.description: James Bond is led to believe that he is targeted by the world's most expensive assassin while he attempts to recover sensitive solar cell technology that is being sold to the highest bidder.

9.name: Death Wish
9.description: A New York City architect becomes a one-man vigilante squad after his wife is murdered by street punks in which he randomly goes out and kills would-be muggers on the mean streets after dark.

10.name: Emmanuelle
10.description: The wife of a French diplomat in Bangkok, Emmanuelle embarks on a voyage of sexual discovery.

11.name: Earthquake
11.description: Various interconnected people struggle to survive when an earthquake of unimaginable magnitude hits Los Angeles, California.

12.name: Murder on the Orient Express
12.description: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.

13.name: Zardoz
13.description: In the distant future, a savage trained only to kill finds a way into the community of bored immortals that alone preserves humanity's achievements.

14.name: Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore
14.description: A recently widowed woman is on the road with her precocious young son, determined to make a new life for herself as a singer.

15.name: The Towering Inferno
15.description: At the opening party of a colossal, but poorly constructed, office building, a massive fire breaks out that threatens to destroy the tower and everyone in it.

16.name: The Conversation
16.description: A paranoid, secretive surveillance expert has a crisis of conscience when he suspects that a couple, on whom he is spying, will be murdered.

17.name: Phantom of the Paradise
17.description: A disfigured composer sells his soul for the woman he loves so that she will perform his music. However, an evil record tycoon betrays him and steals his music to open his rock palace, The Paradise.

18.name: The Great Gatsby
18.description: A Midwesterner becomes fascinated with his nouveau riche neighbor, who obsesses over his lost love.

19.name: Lenny
19.description: The story of acerbic 1960s comic Lenny Bruce, whose groundbreaking, no-holds-barred style and social commentary was often deemed by the Establishment as too obscene for the public.

20.name: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
20.description: In New York, armed men hijack a subway car and demand a ransom for the passengers. Even if it's paid, how could they get away?

21.name: The Longest Yard
21.description: A sadistic warden asks a former pro quarterback, now serving time in his prison, to put together a team of inmates to take on (and get pummeled by) the guards.

22.name: The Sugarland Express
22.description: A woman attempts to reunite her family by helping her husband escape prison and together kidnapping their son. But things don't go as planned when they are forced to take a police hostage on the road.

23.name: The Lords of Flatbush
23.description: A group of kids in Brooklyn form a gang. From this moment on they do everything together. This makes things easier but at the same time they have to face new problems.

24.name: Foxy Brown
24.description: A voluptuous black woman takes a job as a high-class prostitute in order to get revenge on the mobsters who murdered her boyfriend.

25.name: Dark Star
25.description: In the far reaches of space, a small crew, 20 years into their solitary mission, find things beginning to go hilariously wrong.

26.name: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
26.description: With the help of an irreverent young sidekick, a bank robber gets his old gang back together to organize a daring new heist.

27.name: It's Alive
27.description: The Davies expect a baby, which turns out to be a monster with a nasty habit of killing when it's scared. And it's easily scared.

28.name: A Woman Under the Influence
28.description: Mabel, a wife and mother, is loved by her husband Nick but her mental illness proves to be a problem in the marriage.

29.name: Il portiere di notte
29.description: After a chance meeting at a hotel in 1957, Holocaust survivor Lucia and Nazi officer Max, who tortured her, resume their sadomasochistic relationship.

30.name: Flesh Gordon
30.description: Emperor Wang (the Perverted) is leader of the planet Porno and sends his mighty "Sex Ray" towards Earth, turning everyone into sex-mad fiends. Only one man can save the Earth, football ...                See full summary »

31.name: The Arena
31.description: In ancient Rome audiences have grown tired of viewing gladiators fight to the death. Something new is needed--women. (Josiah Howard, "Blaxploitation cinema: The Essential Reference Guide.")

32.name: Vampyres
32.description: A lesbian vampire couple waylay and abduct various passers-by, both male and female, to hold them captive at their rural manor in the English countryside in order to kill and feed on them to satisfy their insatiable thirst for blood.

33.name: Les valseuses
33.description: Two whimsical, aimless thugs harass and assault women, steal, murder, and alternately charm, fight, or sprint their way out of trouble. They take whatever the bourgeois characters value: ...                See full summary »

34.name: Airport 1975
34.description: A 747 in flight collides with a small plane, and is rendered pilotless. Somehow the control tower must get a pilot aboard so the jet can land.

35.name: Big Bad Mama
35.description: Mama and daughters get forced by circumstances into bootlegging and bank robbing, and travel across the country trailed by the law.

36.name: Female Trouble
36.description: A spoiled schoolgirl runs away from home, gets pregnant while hitch-hiking, and ends up as a fashion model for a pair of beauticians who like to photograph women committing crimes.

37.name: Il fiore delle mille e una notte
37.description: Ancient Arabia. A youth is chosen by a beautiful slave girl to be her new master; she is kidnapped and they must search for each other. Stories are told within stories; love, travel and the whims of destiny.

38.name: Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia
38.description: An American bar room pianist and his prostitute girlfriend go on a trip through the Mexican underworld to collect a bounty on the head of a dead gigolo.

39.name: Gone in 60 Seconds
39.description: When a South American drug lord pays Pace to steal 48 cars for him, all but one is in the bag - thereby, the police precipitate in a desperate car chase against Pace and his Eleanor across Southern California.

40.name: The Little Prince
40.description: A pilot, stranded in the desert, meets a little boy who is a prince on a planet.

41.name: The Odessa File
41.description: Following the suicide of an elderly Jewish man, a journalist in possession of the man's diary investigates the alleged sighting of a former S.S. Captain, who commanded a concentration camp during World War II.

42.name: Confessions of a Window Cleaner
42.description: Young Timmy starts as a window cleaner in the little company of his brother. Soon he learns that some female customers expect additional service. Young and curious as he is, he reluctantly ...                See full summary »

43.name: Sweet Movie
43.description: In the contest of the "most virgin" Miss Monde 1984, Miss Canada wins, and prize is the marriage with the milk industry tycoon with his fifty billion dollars fortune. In their honeymoon, ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Front Page
44.description: As a tabloid newspaper editor tries to prevent his top reporter from retiring, an escaped death row convict shows up at the office trying to convey his innocence.

45.name: Blood for Dracula
45.description: An ailing vampire count travels to Italy with his servant to find a bride.

46.name: Gojira tai Mekagojira
46.description: Ape-like aliens build a robotic Godzilla to destroy Japan, and the true Godzilla may not be powerful enough to destroy it.

47.name: Madhouse
47.description: A horror movie star returns to his famous role after years in a mental institution. But the character seems to be committing murders independent of his will.

48.name: From Beyond the Grave
48.description: An anthology of four short horror stories revolving around a British antique shop and its mysterious owner.

49.name: Phase IV
49.description: Desert ants suddenly form a collective intelligence and begin to wage war on the inhabitants. It is up to two scientists and a stray girl they rescue from the ants to destroy them.

50.name: No profanar el sueño de los muertos
50.description: A cop chases two hippies suspected of a series of Manson family-like murders; unbeknownst to him, the real culprits are the living dead, brought to life with a thirst for human flesh by chemical pesticides being used by area farmers.
